question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: new()] [Input Validation] Can an attacker pass an executor_client with zero shards to new(), causing divide-by-zero or panics in subsequent operations like execute_block()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: new()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker create a ShardedBlockExecutor with an arbitrarily large num_shards value, exhausting memory when allocating result vectors in execute_block()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: new()] [State Corruption] Is there validation that the executor_client is properly initialized before use, or can a malformed client lead to undefined behavior during block execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Shard Mismatch Attack] Can an attacker provide PartitionedTransactions with a different num_shards() than the executor's num_shards, bypassing the assertion at line 81-86 through race conditions or allowing partial execution before panic? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Integer Overflow] In line 105 'round * num_executor_shards + shard_id', can an attacker craft transactions with large round numbers causing integer overflow, leading to out-of-bounds writes in ordered_results vector? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Array Index Attack] At line 99 'sharded_output[0].len()', if sharded_output is empty or shards return empty results, can this cause panic or incorrect num_rounds calculation leading to malformed aggregation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State Inconsistency] If different shards return different numbers of rounds in their results, can line 99's assumption that all shards have equal rounds (based on sharded_output[0].len()) lead to partial result aggregation or dropped transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Result Ordering Attack] In the result aggregation loop (lines 103-107), can an attacker exploit the ordering formula 'round * num_executor_shards + shard_id' to reorder transactions maliciously, enabling double-spending or breaking transaction dependencies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Memory Exhaustion] At line 101 'vec![vec![]; num_executor_shards * num_rounds]', can an attacker provide transactions that cause num_rounds to be extremely large, causing memory exhaustion when pre-allocating ordered_results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Race Condition] Does executor_client.execute_block() guarantee atomic execution across all shards, or can a malicious shard complete early and be reordered, leading to inconsistent state commitment? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Error Propagation] When executor_client.execute_block() returns VMStatus error at line 87-95, are partial results from successful shards properly discarded, or can they leak into subsequent block executions causing state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Determinism Violation] If shards execute non-deterministically due to timing issues, will the aggregation at lines 103-111 produce different results on different validators, causing consensus failure and network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Global Output Ordering] At line 114 'aggregated_results.extend(global_output)', can an attacker manipulate transaction partitioning to move critical transactions to global_output, bypassing shard-level checks or changing execution order? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State View Manipulation] Can an attacker provide a malicious state_view that returns inconsistent data to different shards, causing non-deterministic execution results across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Concurrency Level Attack] Can concurrency_level_per_shard be set to extreme values (0 or MAX) causing executor shards to deadlock, panic, or consume excessive resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Result Vector Bounds] In line 105, is there validation that 'round * num_executor_shards + shard_id' stays within bounds of ordered_results vector, or can out-of-bounds write occur with malicious round/shard_id values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Empty Result Attack] If a shard returns empty Vec<TransactionOutput> for a round, will the extend operation at line 110 silently skip those transactions, causing missing transaction outputs and state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Duplicate Result Attack] Can a malicious shard return duplicate transaction outputs, and will the aggregation logic detect this or blindly append duplicates causing double-execution effects? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Cross-Shard Dependency Violation] Does the aggregation ensure cross-shard transaction dependencies are respected, or can reordering by round/shard cause dependent transactions to execute before their dependencies are committed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: shutdown()] [Race Condition] Can shutdown() be called while execute_block() is running, causing shards to be stopped mid-execution and leaving partial results or corrupted state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: shutdown()] [Resource Leak] Does shutdown() properly cleanup all shard threads and channels, or can aborted shutdowns leave zombie threads consuming resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: shutdown()] [Shutdown Bypass] Can an attacker prevent shutdown() from completing by flooding executor shards with commands, causing graceful node shutdown to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Enum: ExecutorShardCommand] [Command Injection] Can an attacker craft malicious ExecuteSubBlocks commands with mismatched shard_id or round numbers that bypass validation in executor shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Enum: ExecutorShardCommand] [Stop Message Attack] Can a malicious actor send Stop commands to individual shards while execution is in progress, causing partial block execution and state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Integration: executor_client] [Client Spoofing] Can a malicious executor_client return crafted ShardedExecutionOutput with manipulated shard results to poison the aggregation logic? (Critical)
